title: Hägglingen
text:
Hägglingen is a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Switzerland">municipality</a> in the district of <a href="Bremgarten%20%28district%29">Bremgarten</a> in the <a href="Cantons%20of%20Switzerland">canton</a> of <a href="Aargau">Aargau</a> in <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>.
History.
The first evidence of a settlement comes from <a href="tumulus">barrow</a>s from the <a href="Hallstatt%20culture">Hallstatt period</a>. There is also evidence of small <a href="Switzerland%20in%20the%20Roman%20era">Roman era</a> settlements.
The first mention of modern Hägglingen is in 1036 when <a href="Counts%20of%20Lenzburg">Count Ulrich von Lenzburg</a> granted the church and farm of "Hekelingen" to <a href="Berom%C3%BCnster">Beromünster</a>. In the acknowledgments of Emperor <a href="Henry%20III%2C%20Holy%20Roman%20Emperor">Henry III</a> in 1045, the village of "Hackelingen" was mentioned. <a href="Frederick%20I%2C%20Holy%20Roman%20Emperor">Frederick I Barbarossa</a> acknowledged the grants to the village in 1173. The <a href="Vogt">Vogt</a>ei (bailiwick) went from the Lenzburg family to the <a href="House%20of%20Kyburg">Kyburgs</a> and then in 1273 to the Lords of Hallwyl. The <a href="High%2C%20middle%20and%20low%20justice">high court</a> rights were exercised by the <a href="House%20of%20Habsburg">Habsburgs</a> until the <a href="Old%20Swiss%20Confederacy">Swiss</a> conquered the Aargau in 1415. It was not until 1425 that Hägglingen, which was claimed by <a href="Lucerne">Lucerne</a>, came under the authority of the entire Confederacy. It was first assigned to the district court of <a href="Wohlenschwil">Wohlenschwil</a> before it became an independent municipality from 1435-1712.
The "Dorfoffnung" regulations of 1609 include laws for the exploitation of forests and regulated irrigation. At this time Hägglingen was acting as a fully independent municipality. Between 1611-13, 150 people died of the plague. It was sacked and partly burned in 1656 by Bernese troops.
The parish church of St. Michael was built in 1457-66, though only the tower and <a href="choir">choir</a> of the original church were retained. The church was expanded in 1638-39, and renovated in 1739. In 1951, the late <a href="Gothic%20art">gothic</a> choir <a href="fresco">fresco</a>es of 1480-90, which had survived the <a href="iconoclasm">iconoclasm</a> of 1529, were discovered.
In addition to agriculture and small businesses, the <a href="straw%20plaiting">straw plaiting</a> industry started in the 18th Century and grew in the 19th to be one of the main industries of the village. The distance to the nearest train station, <a href="Dottikon">Dottikon</a>, delayed industrial development of Hägglingen. By 2003, a number of medium and small businesses, primarily in the <a href="plastics%20industry">plastics industry</a>, offered approximately 520 jobs.
Geography.
Hägglingen has an area, , of . Of this area, 56.8% is used for agricultural purposes, while 32.9% is forested. The rest of the land, (10.3%) is settled.
The municipality is located in the Bremgarten district on an elevated side valley of the "Bünztales". It consists of the village of Hägglingen and the <a href="hamlet%20%28place%29">hamlets</a> of Igelweid and Rüti (since 1823).
Coat of arms.
The <a href="blazon">blazon</a> of the municipal <a href="coat%20of%20arms">coat of arms</a> is "Azure a Flax Comb Or spiked Argent."
Demographics.
Hägglingen has a population (as of ) of . , 13.0% of the population was made up of foreign nationals. Over the last 10 years the population has grown at a rate of 8.1%. Most of the population () speaks German (92.4%), with Albanian being second most common ( 1.6%) and Serbo-Croatian being third ( 1.6%).
The age distribution, , in Hägglingen is; 229 children or 10.5% of the population are between 0 and 9 years old and 264 teenagers or 12.1% are between 10 and 19. Of the adult population, 242 people or 11.1% of the population are between 20 and 29 years old. 330 people or 15.1% are between 30 and 39, 398 people or 18.2% are between 40 and 49, and 289 people or 13.3% are between 50 and 59. The senior population distribution is 202 people or 9.3% of the population are between 60 and 69 years old, 143 people or 6.6% are between 70 and 79, there are 72 people or 3.3% who are between 80 and 89, and there are 12 people or 0.6% who are 90 and older.
 the average number of residents per living room was 0.55 which is about equal to the cantonal average of 0.57 per room. In this case, a room is defined as space of a housing unit of at least as normal bedrooms, dining rooms, living rooms, kitchens and habitable cellars and attics. About 62.9% of the total households were owner occupied, or in other words did not pay rent (though they may have a <a href="Mortgage%20loan">mortgage</a> or a <a href="rent-to-own">rent-to-own</a> agreement). , there were 63 homes with 1 or 2 persons in the household, 295 homes with 3 or 4 persons in the household, and 384 homes with 5 or more persons in the household. The average number of people per household was 2.53 individuals. there were 506 single family homes (or 55.4% of the total) out of a total of 913 homes and apartments. There were a total of 4 empty apartments for a 0.4% vacancy rate. , the construction rate of new housing units was 8.4 new units per 1000 residents.
In the <a href="2007%20Swiss%20federal%20election">2007 federal election</a> the most popular party was the <a href="Swiss%20People%27s%20Party">SVP</a> which received 39% of the vote. The next three most popular parties were the <a href="Christian%20Democratic%20People%27s%20Party%20of%20Switzerland">CVP</a> (21.2%), the <a href="Social%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Switzerland">SP</a> (13.7%) and the <a href="Free%20Democratic%20Party%20of%20Switzerland">FDP</a> (12%).
The entire Swiss population is generally well educated. In Hägglingen about 73.8% of the population (between age 25-64) have completed either non-mandatory <a href="Education%20in%20Switzerland%23Secondary">upper secondary education</a> or additional higher education (either university or a "<a href="Fachhochschule">Fachhochschule</a>"). Of the school age population (), there are 193 students attending <a href="Education%20in%20Switzerland%23Primary">primary school</a>, there are 46 students attending <a href="Education%20in%20Switzerland%23Secondary">secondary school</a> in the municipality.
The historical population is given in the following table:
Economy.
, Hägglingen had an unemployment rate of 1.58%. , there were 128 people employed in the <a href="Primary%20sector%20of%20the%20economy">primary economic sector</a> and about 37 businesses involved in this sector. 436 people are employed in the <a href="Secondary%20sector%20of%20the%20economy">secondary sector</a> and there are 29 businesses in this sector. 174 people are employed in the <a href="Tertiary%20sector%20of%20the%20economy">tertiary sector</a>, with 45 businesses in this sector.
 there was a total of 1,041 workers who lived in the municipality. Of these, 731 or about 70.2% of the residents worked outside Hägglingen while 347 people commuted into the municipality for work. There were a total of 657 jobs (of at least 6 hours per week) in the municipality. Of the working population, 7.4% used public transportation to get to work, and 54.3% used a private car.
Religion.
From the , 1,149 or 57.7% were <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a>, while 464 or 23.3% belonged to the <a href="Swiss%20Reformed%20Church">Swiss Reformed Church</a>. Of the rest of the population, there was 1 individual who belonged to the <a href="Christian%20Catholic%20Church%20of%20Switzerland">Christian Catholic</a> faith.
